description.narrative: ikasso Region has a fairly varied. It is the third geology district mining of Mali, it contains enormous mining potential: Nickel in Kadiolo, Lithium in Bougouni, Aluminium in Koutiala, Gold in Yanfolila, Kadiolo and Bougouni. Other smaller resources exist, such as Copper and Nickel and manganese in the South. It has also more economic potential, these are the areas of agriculture, livestock,wildlife and flore. Le mining sector reported to the state more than 218 billion CFA francs, between 7 and 8% of GDP and 68.5% of export earnings in recent years and also over 5 billion to local authorities. Despite this contribution to the economy, the Commons of these regions with mining industries are faced with local development issues inadequacy of school infrastructure, roads, health, access to drinking water, the abandonment of classes etc. To this must be added the environmental problem due to the pollution generated by operating activities and the treatment of gold .This project aims to strengthen corporatesocial responsibility, training and community organization and elected concerned local mining sites; the establishment of a culture of accountability and social and political dialogue between the actors involved in the management of the mining sector. Asexpected results: The people, the media and CSOs will be better informed and educated on the socio-economic and environmental impacts of mining with effective advocacy Revenues from mines and their use, establishing conventions through information media and analysis made available and accessible Investments by mining companies to communities and communities to communities will be increased and managed more transparently.

participating-org.narrative: Association Malienne pour la Sauveg du Bien-être Familial

The Malian association for Safeguarding the Family Well-being, AMASBIF is a non Governmental Organization created in 1996 accordingto receipt n°0533/MATS-DNAT of July 12, 1996, that signed a convention with the Government of Mali according to the agreement n° 0088/00764/MAT. The association#s vision is : a more and equitable egalitarian society encouraging women and child rights in a HealthyEnvironment. AMASBIF places the human individual at the heart community development. Its mission is to contributeto the improvementof a better life setting and to the promotion of Safeguarding family well-being in the perspective of a lasting and harmonious development of the Malian society in order to reduce In a meaningful way poverty and gender inequalities while taking into account handicap. INSTITUTIONAL OBJECTIVE Goal : AMASBIF goal is to fight for the improvement of living condition for the most marginalized and vulnerable layers of Malian society mainly women and children.
Institutional Objectives : In the long term, AMASBIF whishes to; # Contribute to improving the socio-economic conditions of women and girls in order to significant reduce poverty among them, # Contribute to establishing a more egalitarian and equitable society looking to the respect of fundamental rights (access to clean water, health, education, land, decision making and housing) for women and children. # Support endogen efforts in fighting illiteracy among women, under schooling of girls and marginalized children. # Contributeto the blossoming of marginalized women and girls by supportingbehavior change supportive to their auto promotion. # Contribute to the socio professional insertion of migrating women and girls. # Contribute to improving the life setting (hygiene, reforestation, adaptation to climate change) # Contribute to equitable governance. Field of intervention : With support from technical and financial partners, AMASBIF intervenes in the District of Bamako, the Regions of Koulikoro, Timbuktu, Sikasso Kidal and Gao. Mopti and Kayes and on several fields of activities: # Education- Training - Research ; # Health / Hygiene/ Sanitation ; # Rural economy / Saving and loans ; # Environment ; # Hydraulic ; # Citizenship and Rights. # Advocacy and lobby. # Gender and Governance
